doc.course_introduction: Unlike traditional relational database management systems, NoSQL databases are capable of storing unstructured data. They therefore not only meet the performance, scalability, and flexibility needs that data-intensive applications require but are essential to big data processing. This course covers main NoSQL data management systems topics such as key-value stores, graph databases, and document databases.
doc.course_chapter: Getting Started//What is NoSQL? //Classifications of NoSQL Databases
doc.course_sub_chapter: [['Introduction to NoSQL Database Systems'], ['What is NoSQL?', 'Scalability and CAP Theroem'], ['Graph Databases', 'Key-Value Stores', 'Document Stores', 'NoSQL vs SQL']]
doc.reviews: ["Programming Assignment environment does't work. Poorly instructions on how to move forward, no PPT/PDF available. "]
